title: Setting up an Equation
text: We can simply set P(t) to $$900$$ and then solve for $$t$$. $$900=\frac{1000}{1+9e^{-0.6 t}}$$
speech: We can simply set P(t) to  900  and then solve for  t .  900 is equal to fraction, 1000 over, 1 plus, 9, e raised to the negative 0.6 t power
pacedSpeech: We can simply set P(t) to   900
.   900 is equal to fraction, 1000 over, 1 plus, 9, e raised to the negative 0.6 t power

title: Solving the Equation
text: Now, we must solve for $$t$$ by isolating the variable. $$0.9=\frac{1}{1+9e^{-0.6 t}}$$. This means that $$t=7.3$$
speech: Now, we must solve for  t  by isolating the variable.  0.9, is equal to fraction, 1 over, 1 plus, 9, e raised to the negative 0.6 t power  . This means that  t is equal to 7.3

by isolating the variable.   0.9, is equal to fraction, 1 over, 1 plus, 9, e raised to the negative 0.6 t power
. This means that   t is equal to 7.3
